title: Effect of Thermal Pollution on Lake

content.description: A small lake, located downstream of a power plant, recently experienced a die-off of multiple aquatic species. Environmentalists had been monitoring the temperature of the lake for several months prior to the die-off and noticed a significant spike in the temperature of the lake immediately preceding the die-off event.
content.question: Which of the following best explains why the die-off event occurred in the lake following the increased water temperature?

choices.label: The warm water increased the amount of dissolved oxygen in the water, which led to an increase in the photosynthetic rate of the aquatic organisms.
The warm water increased the amount of dissolved oxygen in the water, which led to an increase in the amount of competition by consumers for food.
The warm water decreased the amount of dissolved oxygen in the water, which led to an increase in the rate of decomposition in the lake.
The warm water decreased the amount of dissolved oxygen in the water, which led to an increase in the respiration rate of the aquatic organisms.

content.answer: The warm water decreased the amount of dissolved oxygen in the water, which led to an increase in the respiration rate of the aquatic organisms.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Explain environmental concepts, processes, or models in applied contexts.
